intro: Zygia cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zygia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, triangular leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in clusters, often in late summer. Zygia cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
